frame.name: Increment
frame.definition:
<def-root>A member or members of a <fen>Class</fen> have just been mentioned or are present in the discourse setting and now a different instance (or group of instances) of the same class is referred to.
<ex>My husband left me for <t>another</t> <fex name="Class">woman</fex> -- and now wants to get back together again!</ex>
<ex>My husband left me for <fex name="Added_set"><t>another</t></fex><fex name="Added_set"> woman</fex> -- and now wants to get back together again!</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Class
FE.definition:
<def-root>The general category of entity which has been referred to.
<ex>My Husband left me for <t>another</t> <fex name="Class">man</fex>!</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Added_set
FE.definition:
<def-root>The instance of the <fen>Class</fen> that is added to the <fen>Initial_set</fen> of entities in the <fen>Class</fen>.
<ex>There was <fex name="as"><t>another</t> power outage</fex> today.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Initial_set
FE.definition:
<def-root>The previously mentioned group of entities of the <fen>Class</fen>.
<ex>A <t>further</t> five incursions <fex name="is">over and above those noted for 1995</fex> took place in the first three months of 1996.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Increment
FE.definition:
<def-root>The number of entities within the <fen>Added_set</fen>.
<ex><fex name="ncr">Four</fex> <t>more</t> years of misguided leadership appeared to be in the offing.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: other.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: separate from one that has already been mentioned

lexUnit.name: another.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: used to refer to a different person or thing from one already referred to

lexUnit.name: other.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a person or thing that is different from one already mentioned or known

lexUnit.name: another.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: used to refer to a different person or thing from one already referred to.

lexUnit.name: additional.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: in addition to existing instances
